data.text: @wsbgnl @DrPanMD Oh look, AFTER the Vaccine was available to them it got worse! Weird.

@wsbgnl The US per capita rate is 22, not including CA.  Not possible statistically or physiologically. US children are not at higher risk than Latinx nor would the virus be more pathogenic in that overall population. I fact, Latinx kids have the highest rates of obesity and diabetes
@wsbgnl US per capita mortality based on 1500 deaths and under 18 population of 74.4. IFR based on CDC seroprevalence study which estimates that 60% of children under 18 have been infected.
@wsbgnl The most impacted and lowest SES group in the United States. 2/

@wsbgnl We can only trust CA numbers. Per capita mortality is 7/1M statewide and 6.8 for Latinx who represent 720k confirmed cases and 3.4M probable (.00085% IFR). How can the US have a per capita rate of 20.2 and an IFR of 0.003? Nationwide rates 3x + higher than the rate for Latinx 1/

@but_rly_tho @wsbgnl Never and still never in the US. Tho China had over 1000 hand foot and mouth disease deaths over a two year period. You want to shut down daycare worldwide? https://t.co/c0Wph52LUw

@joshbucky @wsbgnl You don't know how to compare numbers if you believe that. Under the same conditions, in the last year, COVID deaths exceed flu deaths by a vast margin, and I'm just talking about kids.

https://t.co/0nWbCXjDVM
